reviews.review_msg: Laurie does a good job of keeping the class engaged via class discussions. Expect 4-6hrs of readings/week. Shes an extremely slow marker, expect little feedback. She cancels/moves office hours VERY often. Exams were fair and based off of a review sheet she expects you to complete. Very straight forward prof, if you put in the work you will do well.

Laurie is really nice but I did not really like how she returned the exam and assignment super late, which means no feedback. No feedback, means mistakes you made on the exam will carry over to other assignments and exams within the course. I would recommend this prof, but be aware that there may be a lack of feedback

This course taken with Laurie requires a lot of work for only 3 credits. However it is very enjoyable and you get to learn lots about things that can be applied in real life. The more effort you put in, the more you will get out of it. The weekly participation was tedious but it was helpful when it came to study prep.  12/10 would recommend

This was one of my favourite classes of my undergrad! However, she has high expectations! Be prepared to read AND write a lot. The weekly participation questions were not worth it (the amount of reading and writing you have to do for less than 1% of your mark).

Laurie did her best to make Canadian Healthcare system interesting. I will say that she is helpful during her office hours. That being said, I don't necessarily believe that tutorials and the weekly participation notes are worth it. If you have to take this course, it's better to take it with another prof.
If you can, don't take 305 with this prof. HUGE reading and odd marking. Don't take it with this prof, DON'T.
She is a good professor but most people judge her too soon. office hours are useful if you put an effort. The overall picture makes more sense at the end of semester.  Not for lazy ppl.

I don't understand the bad reviews! Laurie is a good prof and cares about her students. You have a chance to get bonus marks on the group project aka over 100%! I will say tests are a bit tricky but if you study it's nothing impossible.

I dropped this class because she was a huge disappointment. On the very first day of class she classified people on social assistance as "dead-beats". She assigns an INSANE amount of readings and expects "proof" of work done in preparation in each tutorial. so condescending and juvenile.

She is demanding at seems confusing at first but in the end she will reward you if you worked hard. She tries to push you to think outside the box. There is not free marks. She cares if students learned something and if you attend her office hour she will clarify things.

she's been my worst experience in health science department! her assignments are extremely unclear! she doesnt teach anything during class.  she never hands back your grades and assignments but tells you that she will assign 0 to students who are "even 1 minute late". shes never helpful when you seek help from her during office hr. AVOID! SRSLY!
End of August and no grade reported. Worst prof ever, doesn't hand anything back or keep her word on anything

Be prepared for a ton of reading, useless labs and a lot of frustration! Does not hand back assignments, last day of class and no one has any grades so far to know how their doing. Assignments are extremely difficult, marks extremely hard and almost sets you up to fail. By far, hands down the absolute worst prof I have ever had, AVOID!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

So the last day of class was yesterday, & we have yet to receive a SINGLE MARK back yet. We know 0% of our grade and our take home final is due in 7 days with NO feedback or marks to go on. Expect 12+ hours of reading a week, useless tutorials and vague assignment instructions. Midterm paper had too much criteria to meet for a miniscule word count.

Worst prof I have had at SFU, never hands assignments back, does not stick to anything she says she will do yet deducts marks if your assignment is a minute late. Horribly vague despite her pages of instructions for assignments. My biggest regret was not paying more attention to her reviews on here! Awful, horrible at teaching and condescending

Laurie is very unconfident in her teaching abilities and this comes across in her demanding, condescending and vague teachings and assignments. Demands a lot from students but does not give anything back or reward those who put in the effort. Heavy course load on a very interesting subject but she seems to suck the fun and interest out.
AVOID! disorganized and not helpful at all! her class and her method of teaching were terrible. do not take this class with her unless you have to

Wow,Unbelievable!Hard marker,unreal expectations, vague assignments-the worst prof.She is knowledgeable,but does not know how to teach. She has been lying to students about grades. Its Sept29th & grades are not up from the summer class.expects us to hand stuff in on time and gives 0 if even 1 min late,but apparently shes allowed to be 2 months late

A lot of reading!!! High expectations on assignments with vague instructions. May pick on students to answer questions during lecture. Hard marker, very opinionated, strict on punctuality for assignments but doesn't follow through with returning marks.  The final paper was due Aug.16 its almost Oct and still no marks. She doesn't keep office hrs.

THE worst prof ever.She was so unbiased in marking,hasnt even returned our grades yet its been more than 1 month since our course ended.Laurie is knowledgeable but does not know how to teach or deal with students.VERY disorganized. VAGUE assignments.High expectations for no reason. This course should have been very interesting but was ruined by her

This course was disorganized and instructions were vague. Prof is strict about late assignments (zero if handed in even 10 min late), which is understandable, but our marks were handed back late or not at all. Took this course in the summer, it's September and I haven't received my grade for the course because it was submitted late by the prof.

Wow. Just wow. This was a bad prof teaching an interesting course. She was inconsistent with her marking. I rarely go on rate my prof to do this, but she is BAD. She's the type of prof that knows a lot but cannot teach if their life depended on it. Avoid her at all costs.
Instructions for assignments are vague. Assigns them way too late. Marks hard.
good
